Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the impact of the tax cut by stating that "all of it went to folks at the top and corporations that pay no taxes," which is not entirely accurate.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or supporting data to back up the assertion that "all of it went to folks at the top and corporations that pay no taxes."
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that individuals did not feel or receive any benefit from the tax cut, which may not be true for all taxpayers.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores the fact that the Tax Policy Center estimates that about 65 percent of households received a tax cut under the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act, suggesting that there are alternative explanations for the impact of the tax cut.
